headline: Gluten-Free Gingersnap Cookies
description: Made with gluten-free ingredients and fresh ginger, these gingersnap cookies are great for holiday parties and potlucks.
name: Gluten-Free Gingersnap Cookies
recipeIngredient: 1 (1/4 inch thick) slice fresh ginger, grated
0.25 cup unbleached cane sugar, or as needed
0.5 teaspoon ground cinnamon, or as needed
0.25 teaspoon ground nutmeg, or as needed

recipeInstructions.text: Beat butter, brown sugar, and 1/2 cup cane sugar together in a bowl using an electric mixer until creamy. Add egg and mix to combine. Mix in molasses and vanilla extract.

Mix oat flour, almond flour, coconut flour, fresh ginger, ground ginger, baking soda, 1 teaspoon cinnamon, 1 teaspoon nutmeg, and cloves together in a separate bowl. Add to butter mixture slowly and combine. Refrigerate dough for at least 1 hour, to overnight; dough will be very wet before it's chilled.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line 2 large baking sheets with parchment paper.
Combine 1/4 cup cane sugar, 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon, and 1/4 teaspoon nutmeg in a shallow dish.

Scoop dough by tablespoonfuls and roll into balls. Roll balls in cinnamon-sugar mixture to coat and place onto the prepared baking sheets, making sure not to overcrowd the sheets as they will flatten and spread.

Bake in the preheated oven until set and golden, 10 to 12 minutes. Let cookies sit for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool. Serve warm or let cool completely before storing in an airtight container.

review.reviewBody: These were delicious! I was in the last two weeks of FODMAP and craving something sweet. Instead of almond and coconut flour, I had a little bit of brown rice flour and plenty of oat flour. They turned out great and I'll be making these again, even after FODMAP! Thanks!
I accidentally thought that I was supposed to flatten them before baking. They turned out great anyway. Thin and crisp-chewy. So yummy.

I used a small melon baller as these spread alot. Otherwise, I followed the recipe.
Baked for 10 minutes.
